definitions: create a strong barrier to block passage or prevent people from entering an area
examples: They barricaded the door with heavy furniture for protection
Protesters barricaded the street to stop traffic from passing

definitions: exchange goods or services directly without using money as payment between people
examples: The farmers barter vegetables for fresh eggs every Saturday
Ancient civilizations would barter goods along the trade routes

definitions: strike something or someone with great force using heavy blows repeatedly
criticize someone or something severely and publicly in harsh words
examples: He bashed the broken lock with a hammer repeatedly
The waves bashed against the rocky shore during storms
Critics bash the new policy in newspaper editorials daily
Politicians often bash their opponents during heated campaign debates

definitions: lie or relax enjoyably in warmth or pleasant conditions while absorbing comfort
examples: The cat loves to bask in the warm afternoon sunlight
Tourists bask on the beach during their tropical vacation

definitions: arrange or process things in groups or sets at the same time
examples: The bakery batches cookies in dozens for efficient baking
We batch similar emails together to answer them faster

definitions: clean yourself or someone by washing the body with water and soap
cover or surround something with soft light or liquid flowing gently
examples: Parents bathe their baby every evening before bedtime routines
She likes to bathe in warm water with relaxing bubbles
Moonlight bathed the garden in a soft silver glow
The sunset bathed the mountains in golden orange light

definitions: fasten or secure something using strips of wood or metal for strength
examples: Sailors batten down the hatches before the approaching storm
Workers batten the roof tiles to prevent wind damage

definitions: strike someone or something repeatedly with heavy blows causing harm or damage
damage something severely through repeated harsh treatment or continuous violent impact
examples: The boxer battered his opponent with powerful punches continuously
Heavy rain battered the windows throughout the stormy night
Years of storms have battered the old coastal lighthouse significantly
The ship was battered by huge waves during the hurricane

definitions: attack or stab someone using a blade attached to a rifle's end
examples: Soldiers were trained to bayonet straw dummies during practice
The guard threatened to bayonet anyone who approached the gate

definitions: send signals or guidance using bright light to help navigation or communication
examples: The lighthouse beacons ships safely through the dangerous channel
Emergency towers beacon rescue helicopters to the crash site

definitions: form into small round drops on a surface like pearls or bubbles
examples: Sweat beaded on his forehead during the intense workout
Morning dew beaded on the spider web like tiny diamonds

definitions: face or challenge someone boldly in their own territory despite danger or risk
examples: The journalist decided to beard the politician at headquarters
She bearded her intimidating boss about the unfair treatment

definitions: improve the appearance of something by adding decorative elements or enhancing existing features
examples: The city beautifies parks by planting colorful flower gardens
Volunteers beautify the neighborhood by painting old building murals

definitions: work extremely hard and persistently on a task with great energy and determination
examples: Students beaver away at their final projects before graduation
The team beavered through the night to meet the deadline

definitions: produce a short high electronic sound as a signal or warning alert
examples: The microwave beeps when your food is ready to eat
Cars beep their horns in heavy traffic during rush hour

definitions: happen to someone especially something bad or unfortunate as an unexpected event
examples: A terrible tragedy befell the family during their vacation trip
Whatever may befall us, we must stay strong and united

definitions: act in a friendly way toward someone and develop a friendship relationship
examples: She quickly befriended her new neighbors after moving in
The shy student befriended a classmate who shared similar interests

definitions: reduce someone to poverty or make them extremely poor through loss or hardship
be impossible to describe or exceed what can be imagined or believed
examples: The economic crisis beggared thousands of families across the nation
Medical bills beggared them despite having worked their entire lives
The beauty of the sunset beggars description in mere words
Her generosity beggars belief considering her own financial struggles

definitions: execute someone by cutting off their head as a form of capital punishment
examples: Medieval kings would behead traitors in the public square
The tyrant threatened to behead anyone who opposed his rule

definitions: look at or observe something remarkable with attention and often wonder or amazement
examples: Behold the magnificent sunset painting the sky with colors
Tourists behold ancient ruins with awe during their guided visit

definitions: stop or cancel an action or order especially in nautical or military contexts
secure a climbing rope by wrapping it around a fixed point for safety
examples: The captain shouted to belay that order immediately before disaster
Belay the preparations until we receive further instructions from headquarters
The climber must belay the rope before his partner ascends
Always belay properly to prevent dangerous falls while rock climbing

definitions: make a loud deep roaring shout like an angry bull or person
examples: The angry coach bellowed instructions from the sidelines constantly
The wounded elephant bellowed in pain across the African savanna

definitions: leave property or money to someone in a will after death as inheritance
examples: My grandmother bequeathed her jewelry collection to her granddaughters
The wealthy businessman bequeathed millions to various charitable organizations

definitions: gather or pick berries from bushes or plants for eating or use
examples: Children love to berry in the woods during summer vacation
We berry every August to make homemade jam and preserves

definitions: provide a sleeping place or bed especially on a ship or train
bring a ship into a dock or mooring place and secure it
examples: The cruise ship can berth two thousand passengers in comfort
The conductor will berth you in the sleeper car tonight
The captain expertly berthed the yacht in the crowded marina
Large cargo ships berth at the port to unload containers

definitions: trouble or harass persistently from all sides with problems or difficulties
examples: Financial problems beset the struggling company throughout the recession
Doubts and fears beset her mind before the important interview

definitions: surround a place with armed forces to capture it or force surrender
crowd around someone demanding attention or overwhelm with requests and questions persistently
examples: The enemy army besieged the castle for three long months
Ancient warriors would besiege cities until the defenders surrendered
Reporters besieged the celebrity outside the courthouse seeking comments
Fans besieged the author for autographs after her book reading

definitions: give something valuable or honorable to someone as a gift or honor formally
examples: The university will bestow honorary degrees upon distinguished graduates
The queen bestowed knighthood on the brave soldier for valor

definitions: cut an edge or surface at an angle rather than perpendicular or square
examples: The carpenter will bevel the wood edges for a professional finish
Glass makers bevel mirror edges to create decorative reflective borders

definitions: be cautious and alert to dangers or risks that might cause harm
examples: Beware of the dog signs warn visitors about aggressive pets
Swimmers must beware of strong currents near the rocky shore

definitions: argue about petty and trivial matters in an annoying persistent way between people
examples: The siblings bicker constantly about who gets the TV remote
Neighbors bicker over the property line between their two yards

definitions: provide temporary lodging for soldiers in civilian homes or other non-military buildings
examples: The army will billet troops in local homes during exercises
Officers were billeted in the town hall during the military operation

definitions: throw something away into a waste container or discard as no longer useful
examples: Please bin the empty bottles in the recycling container outside
She decided to bin all her old magazines during spring cleaning

definitions: indulge in an activity excessively especially eating drinking or watching in short periods
examples: Many people binge on junk food when feeling stressed or sad
Students often binge watch entire TV series during weekend breaks

definitions: beat or whip someone with a birch rod as a form of punishment
examples: Teachers would birch disobedient students in old boarding schools
The cruel master threatened to birch servants for minor mistakes

definitions: score one stroke under par on a golf hole in a round
examples: The golfer managed to birdie three holes during today's tournament
She hopes to birdie the final hole to win the championship

definitions: make a temporary camp without tents or with minimal shelter usually by soldiers
examples: The soldiers had to bivouac in the forest during training
Hikers sometimes bivouac under the stars on clear mountain nights

definitions: gather blackberries from thorny bushes for eating or cooking in late summer
examples: Children love to blackberry along country lanes in August sunshine
We blackberry every year to make delicious pies and jams

definitions: hit someone with a blackjack weapon which is a short leather-covered club
force or coerce someone to do something through threats or pressure tactics
examples: The thug tried to blackjack the guard during the robbery
Criminals would blackjack victims in dark alleys for their wallets
The gang tried to blackjack him into joining their illegal scheme
Corrupt officials blackjack businesses into paying protection money regularly

definitions: put someone on a list of people who are banned or excluded from something
examples: The company will blacklist suppliers who deliver poor quality goods
Hollywood studios would blacklist actors suspected of communist sympathies

definitions: demand money or favors by threatening to reveal embarrassing or harmful information about someone
examples: The criminal tried to blackmail the politician with compromising photos
She refused to let her ex-boyfriend blackmail her with old secrets

definitions: become white or pale from shock fear or other strong emotion suddenly
immerse vegetables briefly in boiling water then cold water to partially cook
examples: She blanched when hearing the terrible news about the accident
His face blanched with fear when seeing the dangerous snake
Chefs blanch tomatoes to remove their skins more easily afterward
Always blanch broccoli before adding it to your stir-fry dish

definitions: influence or persuade someone using charm flattery and smooth talk to gain favor
examples: Politicians blarney voters with promises during election campaign speeches
He tried to blarney his way out of the parking ticket

definitions: burn with bright flames and intense heat producing light and consuming fuel rapidly
mark a trail through wilderness by cutting marks on trees for navigation
examples: The campfire blazed warmly on the cold mountain night air
The house blazed for hours before firefighters controlled the flames
Pioneers would blaze trails through forests for future travelers
Park rangers blaze new hiking paths with painted marks annually

definitions: display or proclaim something widely and prominently for everyone to see or know
examples: Newspapers blazon the scandal across their front pages boldly today
The company blazons its logo on billboards throughout the city

definitions: make something white or lighter using chemicals that remove color through oxidation
examples: Many people bleach their hair to achieve a blonde color
Hospitals bleach linens to kill germs and maintain pure whiteness

definitions: replace offensive words in broadcasts with an electronic beep sound for censorship
examples: Television networks bleep profanity during family viewing hours automatically
Radio stations must bleep explicit lyrics in songs before broadcasting

definitions: damage or spoil the appearance or quality of something that was previously perfect
examples: One small scratch can blemish the car's otherwise perfect paint
Gossip and rumors blemish her previously spotless reputation in town

definitions: cause something to deteriorate become spoiled or fail to develop properly through disease
examples: Disease can blight entire crops leaving farmers with nothing profitable
Urban decay blights once-thriving neighborhoods in many older industrial cities

definitions: cover someone's eyes with cloth or bandage so they cannot see anything
examples: They blindfold participants before the surprise party entrance is revealed
Children blindfold each other when playing pin the tail games
